intro: Acleisanthes nana, commonly known as the dwarf acleisanthes, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, showy flowers. The plant typically features hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and they bloom in the spring. Acleisanthes nana thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
